scoring_rule: Each problem: ALL words must be correct. Level: 80% of problems must pass.

problems.prompt:
# Syllable Puzzle

Find 8 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
na, tached, de, sil, err, ca, fos, dis, ing, tions, at, tract, scribe, kia, i, palaces, sion, oc, nom

## Clues
A. (2 syllables) — SYN: dodo
B. (2 syllables) — SYN: affiliated
C. (3 syllables) — SYN: cark
D. (1 syllables) — SYN: castle
E. (1 syllables) — SYN: drift
F. (1 syllables) — A vehicle of the Kia brand.
G. (5 syllables) — SYN: appellation
H. (3 syllables) — SYN: affair

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
ing, amend, or, cal, ing, er, nate, ful, spray, shoved, kids, um, dry, ci, cadets, et, co, di, mean

## Clues
A. (3 syllables) — Having meaning, significant.
B. (2 syllables) — (of food) eaten without a spread or sauce or other garnish
C. (4 syllables) — To match (objects, especially clothes).
D. (1 syllables) — a military trainee (as at a military academy)
E. (1 syllables) — push roughly
F. (2 syllables) — be discharged in sprays of liquid
G. (1 syllables) — make amendments to
H. (3 syllables) — An atom of this element.
I. (1 syllables) — soft smooth leather from the hide of a young goat

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 9 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
un, charges, ski, scar, ing, oz, wood, ed, dis, pres, sad, ners, avatar, cor, sour, reprint, dam, ley, der, mae

## Clues
A. (1 syllables) — go [masked] or spoil
B. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: dis-) — pronounce not guilty of criminal charges
C. (3 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: under-) — A typewriter made by the [masked] Typewriter Company.
D. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: co-) — a remote area
E. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: pre-) — United States rock singer whose many hit records and flamboyant style greatly influenced American popular music (1935-1977)
F. (2 syllables) — Iraqi leader who waged war against Iran; his invasion of Kuwait led to the Gulf War (born in 1937)
G. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (suffix: -ing) — cause fear in
H. (1 syllables) — One of a pair of long flat runners designed for gliding over snow or water.
I. (2 syllables) — Structure hint: (prefix: re-, suffix: -ed) — print anew

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank

## Clues

G. (3 syllables) — A venture that fails spectacularly, especially one perceived as overconfident.

Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.

# Syllable Puzzle

Find 10 words using the syllables from the bank.
Each syllable is used exactly once (extras are distractors).

## Syllable Bank
ties, sion, i, scares, cial, are, pris, pro, tal, fa, vin, pierc, tarot, ons, flux, here, in, ing, ford

## Clues
A. (1 syllables) — cause to lose courage
B. (2 syllables) — a prisonlike situation; a place of seeming confinement
C. (4 syllables) — the quality of being able to cause death or fatal disasters
D. (1 syllables) — originally a stronghold captured by David (the 2nd king of the Israelites); above it was built a temple and later the name extended to the whole hill; finally it became a synonym for the city of Jerusalem
E. (2 syllables) — hardy English breed of dairy cattle raised extensively in United States
F. (2 syllables) — That which flows or comes in.
G. (1 syllables) — happen, occur, take place
H. (3 syllables) — (Roman Catholic Church) an official in charge of an ecclesiastical province acting under the superior general of a religious order
I. (1 syllables) — any of a set of (usually 72) cards that include 22 cards representing virtues and vices and death and fortune etc.; used by fortunetellers
J. (2 syllables) — sound sharply or shrilly

## Answer Format
Return JSON: {"answers": ["WORD1", "WORD2", ...]}
Words must be UPPERCASE and in clue order.
